The list is fine, especially when trying to better characterize a bug, 
or something that might or might not be a bug, or get wider discussion.

But, you can also enter reports directly to the project bug tracker, at:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER

(Trying to login without an account offers a 'signup' link under the 
username field.)

This is definitely a bug, thanks the report. I haven't seen it yet in 
longer crawls on a couple systems, so triggering it might require 
something timing-specific to your configuration.

Could you make a JIRA issue, include a representative stack or two, and 
include details on:

- the system showing the problem (cores, OS, JVM version)
- notable customizations to your crawl configuration

???

- Gordon @ IA


On 12/7/10 3:29 PM, Zach Bailey wrote:
>
>
> I have been testing out some of the 3.0.1 "bleeding edge" releases from
> http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.0.1-SNAPSHOT/for
> potential performance improvements and other functionality tweaks and
> I'm running into the following exception thrown after a couple of
> minutes of crawling which appears to be a bug:
>
> java.lang.IllegalStateException
> at com.sleepycat.collections.BlockIterator.remove(BlockIterator.java:590)
> at org.archive.crawler.fron
> tier.WorkQueueFrontier.wakeQueues(WorkQueueFrontier.java:865)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.findEligibleURI(WorkQueueFrontier.java:591)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.next(AbstractFrontier.java:432)
> at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:133)
>
> This bug is present in the latest 3.0.1 SNAPSHOT (20101206) build as
> well as the 20101123 build and presumably all builds in between.
>
> In the future is there a better procedure to report these things rather
> than spammin g everyone on the list? (for the fourth time today, sorry
> folks!) :)
>
> Thanks,
> Zach
>
>
>
